name: pitchy
content:
pitchy adjective
(LIKE PITCH)
Add to word list
Add to word list
like or containing pitch (= a thick, black substance that was used in the past to stop water getting into wooden ships and buildings): A pitchy smell filled the whole area. She was holding a pitchy torch that filled the passage with smoke.
black or very dark: They sat and waited in the pitchy darkness. I struggled to find my way along the pitchy corridors.
More examplesFewer examplesA column of pitchy smoke rose up above the village.I stared out at the pitchy gloom.There was a flash of light followed by a pitchy blackness.

pitchy adjective
(SINGING)
not always singing notes at the correct pitch (= level): The judges have criticized her for being too pitchy. Some of the songs in the opening act were annoyingly pitchy.
More examplesFewer examplesHer voice may be a little pitchy but she has plenty of admirers.He was pitchy at times, but the concert was still a great success. The first part of the song was very pitchy.
